meanings.definition: An offer made in response to a previous offer.
meanings.sent1: After receiving a job offer, she made a counteroffer for a higher salary.
meanings.sent2: The real estate agent presented a counteroffer to the buyer on behalf of the seller.
meanings.sent3: The counteroffer from the seller was unexpected but fair.
meanings.sent4: His counteroffer was like a chess move, strategically positioning himself for negotiation.
meanings.sent5: The counteroffer was a game-changer, altering the course of the business deal.

meanings.definition: To make an offer in response to a previous offer.
meanings.sent1: She decided to counteroffer the proposed price for the car.
meanings.sent2: Negotiating parties often counteroffer to find a middle ground.
meanings.sent3: He playfully counteroffered with a joke, lightening the tense atmosphere.
meanings.sent4: In the art of bargaining, knowing when to counteroffer is crucial.
meanings.sent5: The customer chose to counteroffer, hoping for a better deal.
